intro: Oncostemum botryoides, commonly known as the clustered bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, with a hairy texture. Oncostemum botryoides is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
